data: Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase.  These orders continue on the inpatient unit
q1h for 24 hour, q2h for 12 hours, then if stable q4h for 24 hours
q1h until fully awake, then q2h for 12 hours, then if stable q4h for 24 hours, then BID until discharge
Site: Surgical Incision(s), Reinforce PRN, Notify provider if dressing changed or reinforced
Site: Surgical Incision(s), Change dressing PRN, Reinforce PRN, Notify provider if dressing reinforced
Site: Surgical Incision(s), Change dressing; reinforced dressing POD 2 or sooner
Site: Surgical Incision(s), Change dressing; on post-op day 2
If urine output greater than 350 mL/h for 2 consecutive hours, do STAT electrolytes and notify provider if sodium greater than 145 mmol/L
If/when urine output greater than 350 mL/h for 2 consecutive hours, then order STAT electrolytes and notify provider if sodium greater than 145 mmol/L
If PVR greater than 400 mL, PRN
PRN, Insert indwelling Catheter if patient is unable to void x 3 and in/out catheterization has been performed, and notify the treating provider.
When mobilizing or if patient complains of discomfort
May elevate head to eat or drink

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
